text: so here I am on train 77 from Moscow to
Mariupol I'm going to be getting out in
Dan yet skin a few hours time now the
ticket inspectors here tell me that
normally at this time of year this train
is packed with passengers a lot of
people getting onto the train in Moscow
and going to the resort town of Mariupol
for their summer holidays that's not the
case this year just look at this this
carriage like many of the carriages on
this train is totally empty there are no
passengers here at all but from me
that's because of very difficult
situation at the moment in eastern
Ukraine a lot of people too frightened
to travel to that region now the journey
from Moscow to done yet should take
around 19 hours in fact I've just been
told by the ticket inspector it's gonna
take longer today because the train has
to go around places like slavyansk and
kramatorsk which have begun flashpoints
in this ukrainian conflict well I've
been on the train now for more than 17
hours and we've just made an unscheduled
stop at this village station
now even the train guards admit that
they don't know what the route is going
to be from now on they don't know what
the next station is going to be because
apparently the train driver is trying to
work out a safe route through to the
final destination that would avoid any
pockets of fighting
